intro: Aneilema forskalii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which come in shades of red, pink, and white, are pollinated by birds and insects. Aneilema forskalii is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its preference for bright, indirect light and consistent moisture.
